key_points: CNN fired senior producer John Griffin after he was arrested and charged with federal child sex crimes.
Griffin faces three counts of using interstate commerce to attempt to entice minors into unlawful sexual activity.
He allegedly used apps like Kik and Google Hangouts to communicate with parents, persuading them to allow him to 'train' their daughters to be sexually submissive.
The indictment claims Griffin paid a mother to bring her 9-year-old daughter to his house, where she engaged in unlawful sexual activity.
Griffin also allegedly transferred over $3,000 for plane tickets for the mother and her 9-year-old daughter to fly to Boston.
According to the DOJ, Griffin tried to persuade two other children to engage in sexual acts through the internet.
The charges against Griffin could result in a minimum sentence of 10 years imprisonment per count, with a possible maximum of a life sentence if convicted.
The federal government intends to seek the forfeiture of Griffin's house, his Tesla, a Mercedes, and other property used in committing the offenses.
Griffin's connections with former CNN anchor Chris Cuomo are noted, as he claimed to work 'shoulder-to-shoulder' with him.
CNN suspended then fired Griffin immediately following his arrest and the internal investigation into his conduct.
